text: Jeane Dixon (born Lydia Emma Pinckert, 5 January 1904 â€“ 25 January 1997) was an American psychic and astrologist. She also wrote newspaper columns. She reportedly predicted certain major events of the 20th century. She also wrote many novels. She was known for working with Nancy Reagan to protect her husband, Ronald Reagan from any danger spiritually. Dixon was born in Medford, Wisconsin. She died from cardiac arrest at 93. Category:Writers from Wisconsin Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:1904 births Category:1997 deaths
title: Jeane Dixon
